content: The best cowboy movies were television cowboys in the 1950's. Half-hour flicks every week. The Lone Ranger with his partner Tonto. And, the Cisco Kid. . . eh. . . Poncho. . . . . eh. . . . . Cisco. And that football player who turned space cowboy. . . Flash Gordon. And when he and his girlfriend did battle with Ming the world was safer.

content: quote: Originally posted by FrJohn1123: quote: Originally posted by Ira1945: quote: John Houston at their best. dont you mean john ford?? Yes Thanks for the assist. on AMC there was a sort of production that was John Ford, then and now, and it was filmed on the location in monument valley where many of his movies were filmed.. and had many of the extras, really was informative and showed some of the reasons that ford was just so FUGGIN GREAT!!! they interviewed some of the (still alive) indians and they said that they did it mainly to have fun and relive what they never knew, some said they would have done it for free and then the (possibly) greatest horsman alive ben johnson, who also won many (team?? rodeo) awards, man could that man ride a horse Yellow ribbon, ft apache man could he sit on a horse

content: "Silverado"...Kevin Kline, Ed Harris, Kevin Costner, Brian Dennehy, Danny Glover... It was Lawrence Kasdan's tribute to the western... "Tombstone"...Kurt Russel, Sam Eliott. Filmed at Old Tucson Studios, Mescal (part of OT studios). "The Quick and The Dead"...Sharon Stone, Gene Hackman, Leonardo Dicaprio and Russell Crowe. Filmed at the Old Tucson Studios (Mescal) site. This message has been edited. Last edited by: Hoffy1951, Fri 01 May 2009 04:53 AM
